Detailed Description

Class for communicate output spikes.

This class abstract methods for communicate the output spikes to the external system. Its subclasses implements the output target and methods.

Author:
Jesus Garrido

Richard Carrillo

Date:
August 2008

virtual void OutputSpikeDriver::WriteSpike ( const Spike *  NewSpike  )  throw (EDLUTException) [pure virtual]

It communicates the output activity to the external system.

This method introduces the output spikes to the output target (file, tcpip system...).

Parameters:
NewSpike The spike for print.
Exceptions:
EDLUTException If something wrong happens in the output process.

virtual bool OutputSpikeDriver::IsBuffered (  )  const [pure virtual]

It checks if the current output driver is buffered.

This method checks if the current output driver has an output buffer.

Returns:
True if the current driver has an output buffer. False in other case.
